action.name: memcached.lookup
action.short: searches the content in a memcached database

entry.name: headers
entry.short: (boolean, not supported yet) whether to lookup headers too. if false content-type determined by request.uri.path (default: false)

parameter.name: action-hit
parameter.short: action to run on cache hit (lookup was successful)

parameter.name: action-miss
parameter.short: action to run on cache miss (lookup was not successful)

action.name: memcached.store
action.short: searches the content in a memcached database

entry.name: ttl
entry.short: ttl for storing (default 30; use 0 if you want to cache "forever")

entry.name: maxsize
entry.short: maximum size in bytes we want to store (default: 64*1024)

entry.name: headers
entry.short: (boolean, not supported yet) whether to store headers too (default: false)

section.title: lua API
section.textile:
Exports a lua api to per-worker luaStates too (for use in lua.handler):
@memcached.new(address)@ creates a new connection; a connection provides: * @req = con:get(key, cb | vr)@ * @req = con:set(key, value, cb | vr, [ttl])@ * @con:setq(key, value, [ttl])@
If a callback was given, the callback gets called with a response object; otherwise the response will be in req.response when ready.
The response object has: * @code@: 1 - Ok, 2 - Not stored, 3 - Exists, 4 - Not found, 5 - Error * @error@: error message * @key@: the lookup key * @flags@ * @ttl@ * @cas@ * @data@
